question: Pablo Picasso was born in the Spanish city of Málaga. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was born in 1879. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was widely regarded as the co-founder of Cubism. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s father was a teacher of art. True or False?
Pablo Picasso spent most of his adult life in Germany. True or False?
Pablo Picasso is associated with both the Blue Period and the Rose Period. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Les Demoiselles d’Avignon' is considered a major precursor to Cubism. True or False?
Pablo Picasso created approximately 50,000 artworks over his lifetime. True or False?
Pablo Picasso died in 1985. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Guernica' was a reaction to the Spanish Civil War. True or False?
Pablo Picasso is known to have had a brief 'Surrealist period' in the 1930s. True or False?
Pablo Picasso married only once in his entire life. True or False?
Pablo Picasso refused to return to Spain while it was under the dictatorship of Francisco Franco. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s mother was born in Russia. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Blue Period' was partly inspired by the death of his friend Carlos Casagemas. True or False?
Pablo Picasso once worked closely with Georges Braque to develop Cubism. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was born in 1881. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'The Old Guitarist' is part of his Rose Period. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s full name contains more than 20 words. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s father specialized in painting pigeons. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was once questioned by police over the theft of the Mona Lisa in 1911. True or False?
Pablo Picasso spent a significant part of his youth in London, where he was influenced by English painters. True or False?
Pablo Picasso has been credited with introducing collage into fine art. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Girl before a Mirror' is traditionally associated with his Blue Period. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was an active member of the French Communist Party starting in 1944. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s Rose Period is known for its frequent use of somber blues and grays. True or False?
One of Pablo Picasso’s earliest major exhibitions took place in Paris in 1901. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Les Demoiselles d’Avignon' features five nude women in a brothel setting. True or False?
During World War II, Pablo Picasso remained in Paris under German occupation. True or False?
Pablo Picasso moved to the Montmartre district of Paris in 1904. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s daughter, Paloma, is known for her work in jewelry design. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was an accomplished sculptor in addition to being a painter. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Guernica' now resides permanently in the Louvre Museum in Paris. True or False?
Pablo Picasso died in Mougins, France, in 1973. True or False?
Pablo Picasso produced only around 100 paintings throughout his career. True or False?
Pablo Picasso had a longstanding friendship with poet Guillaume Apollinaire. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was once incorrectly credited with painting 'The Persistence of Memory,' which is actually by Salvador Dalí. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s sculpture series includes works made from bicycle handlebars and seat parts. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s early interest in art was encouraged by his mother, who was a famous opera singer. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s friend Carlos Casagemas died by suicide, an event that profoundly affected Picasso’s art. True or False?
Pablo Picasso had a child named Maya with his companion Marie-Thérèse Walter. True or False?
Pablo Picasso created numerous lithographs and prints in addition to his paintings. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was known for his strong hostility toward political activism. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was influenced by African masks, which partially inspired 'Les Demoiselles d’Avignon.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s first wife was Olga Khokhlova, a Russian ballet dancer. True or False?
Pablo Picasso learned to speak fluent English during his teenage years in London. True or False?
At age 9, Pablo Picasso supposedly created his first oil painting, called 'Le Picador.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Woman Ironing' belongs to his Blue Period. True or False?
Pablo Picasso first traveled to Paris in the early 1900s, where he later set up his studio in Montmartre. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'The Old Guitarist' depicts a vibrant, joyous scene with dancing figures. True or False?
Pablo Picasso had a notable friendly rivalry with Henri Matisse. True or False?
During the Rose Period, Pablo Picasso often painted circus performers and harlequins using warm pink tones. True or False?
Pablo Picasso preferred the name Ruiz over the name Picasso, signing most works 'Pablo Ruiz.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso once said, 'Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Three Musicians' is an example of his Synthetic Cubism phase. True or False?
Pablo Picasso never experimented with ceramic work or sculpture. True or False?
The Museum of Modern Art in New York once hosted an extensive Pablo Picasso retrospective in 1939. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s piece 'Le Rêve' (The Dream) was famously damaged by its owner, Steve Wynn, in 2006. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s father, Don José Ruiz, initially taught him the basics of art when he was a child. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Ma Jolie' (1911-12) is considered part of his Rose Period. True or False?
Pablo Picasso co-exhibited with Georges Braque, leading to the earliest recognition of Cubism. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Dora Maar au Chat' was once one of the most expensive paintings ever sold at auction. True or False?
Pablo Picasso lived in the Montmartre district at a studio building called 'Le Bateau-Lavoir.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso is credited with designing sets and costumes for the Ballets Russes. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Garçon à la pipe' (Boy with a Pipe) never sold for more than $10 million. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was the first artist to have a solo exhibition at the Louvre in his lifetime. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Weeping Woman' series was created around the same time as 'Guernica.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso rarely depicted bullfighting or Spanish cultural motifs in his works. True or False?
Pablo Picasso said, 'I do not seek, I find.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso was born just a decade before World War I started. True or False?
Pablo Picasso never experimented with collage or found objects in his art. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Las Meninas' series was a set of reinterpretations of Diego Velázquez’s masterpiece. True or False?
Pablo Picasso once declared, 'Everything you can imagine is real.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s father wanted him to become a lawyer, but he chose art instead. True or False?
Pablo Picasso died at the age of 91. True or False?
Pablo Picasso moved from the Blue Period directly to his Cubist Period, with no intermediate 'Rose Period.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso was known to sign many of his paintings simply as 'Picasso,' rather than his full name. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s mother was named Maria Picasso y Lopez. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'Massacre in Korea' was influenced by the Napoleonic Wars. True or False?
Pablo Picasso remained neutral and did not join any political parties. True or False?
Pablo Picasso once said, 'Good artists copy, great artists steal.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painting 'Still Life with Chair Caning' is considered an example of Synthetic Cubism. True or False?
Pablo Picasso primarily spoke Spanish as his first language. True or False?
Pablo Picasso died before completing any ceramic or pottery works. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s father was Don José Ruiz Blasco. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s famous mural 'Guernica' was commissioned by the French government. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 1907 painting 'Les Demoiselles d’Avignon' was initially met with shock and controversy. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s full name starts with 'Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula.' True or False?
Pablo Picasso often reused canvases and painted over older pieces to save money. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s body of work includes paintings, sculptures, ceramics, and drawings. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s 'La Vie' is associated with the Rose Period. True or False?
Pablo Picasso created set designs for Sergei Diaghilev’s Ballets Russes in the early 20th century. True or False?
Pablo Picasso admired and was influenced by the work of Paul Cézanne. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s longtime companion Françoise Gilot was a famous sculptor. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s artwork is found in major museums worldwide, including the Musée Picasso in Paris. True or False?
Pablo Picasso was rumored to have had his first word as “lápiz,” meaning “pencil” in Spanish. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s father once felt his son had surpassed his own artistic abilities while still a child. True or False?
Pablo Picasso occasionally employed the technique of collage, even incorporating newspaper scraps. True or False?
Pablo Picasso’s painted interpretation of Velázquez’s 'Las Meninas' comprises over 50 separate works. True or False?
Pablo Picasso is primarily classified as a Renaissance painter. True or False?
Pablo Picasso once lived at a place called 'Le Bateau-Lavoir,' an old wooden structure in Montmartre. True or False?
At one point, Pablo Picasso was married to Jacqueline Roque. True or False?
Pablo Picasso rejected the concept of painting multiple viewpoints in a single image. True or False?
Pablo Picasso outlived both Georges Braque and Henri Matisse. True or False?
